page.title: 10Ecology: Habitats
page.content: The non-arable areas are the banks of Bottisham and Swaffham lodes, the bank and wash of the River Cam, ditches, droveways, verges and a few hedges. In addition there is a stretch of pasture along the west bank of Swaffham lode, and a stand of trees with mixed scrub known as Swaffham Poor's Fen. This latter area is heavily shot over by people from Swaffham Bulbeck. Of the two lodes, Swaffham is the deeper and wider, supports more plant life, and, unlike Bottisham lode, is habitually closed off from the River by lock gates, so the water level, whilst no more that two or three feet in depth, is consistent. Bottisham Lode has a gate, but this is usually open and the water level fluctuates between a few feet and a few inches.
